intro: Pentameris densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered pentameris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense inflorescences, which consist of small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy appearance. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
